CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 6, 1953, pg. 27 reads: "Help LL Here - The above major league baseball players were present at Kennard Field to give youngsters, who might some day replace them in the big league, a rousing sendoff in their Little League opener.  The players on hand for the opening day ceremonies for the Uptown Little League were, left to right, back row: Roy Campanella, Brooklyn; Geare [Gair] Allie, Pittsburgh Pirates; Jackie Robinson, Brooklyn; Joe Black, Brooklyn; Carlos Bernier, Pittsburgh, and Sam Narron, Pittsburgh scout.  The youngsters, shown in the front row, are captains and co-captains of the four teams in the circuit.  They are left to right, Douglas Jones,  Charles Evans, Thomas Wallace, Stanley [Sterling] Smith, Joe Lewis and Larry Huffard [Hubbard]. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Baseball players, including Curtis Reynolds with hands in pockets, Brooklyn Dodgers players Roy Campanella, Jackie Robinson, and Joe Black, Pittsburgh Pirates Gair Allie, Carlos Bernier, and Pirates scout Sam Narron, gathered on Kennard Field for Uptown Little League baseball opening day ceremonies
